Author: Aanchal Munoth, Maryann Manasseh and Nandhini Thangavelu
Article Title: Mental Health of Caregivers of Physical Ailments Through the Lens of Transactional Analysis and Socio-Political Psychotherapy
TA and Other Concepts: Ego states, Life positions, Drivers, Injunctions
Key words: Caregiving, Health, Burnout, Stress, Barrier, Socio-political, Gender, Accesibility, Support, Emotions, Economic status, Ego States, Drivers, Injunctions, Life Positions
Summary of Article: The article elaborates on research to understand and analyse mental health of caregivers through the concepts of Transactional Analysis and the lens of socio-political psychotherapy.

Author: Raguraman K
Article Title: The Role Economy Corral: Gaining Effectiveness and Resilience
TA and Other Concepts: Time Structuring, Miniscripts, Okness, Types of Script
Key words: Role, Resources, Role Economy, Inadequacy, Burnout, Implosion, Effectiveness and Resilience Spiral, Self-esteem, Trust
Summary of Article: The article proposes two models Role Economy Corral and Effectiveness and Resilience Spiral to optimize effectiveness and resilience in organizational settings; Role Economy Corral has four quadrants on the dimensions of role competence and effective use of resources and Effectiveness and Resilience spiral recommends how one can build both these qualities.

Author: Till Schulz-Robinson
Article Title: A Transactional Analysis Model of Motivation: The Dynamic Motivation Pyramid
TA and Other Concepts: Psychological hungers, Structure hunger, Stimulus hunger, Recognition, Strokes, Parental Programming,
Key words: Motivation, Meaning, Transactional Analysis, Basic needs, Homeostasis, TA Dynamic Model of Motivation
Summary of Article: The article introduces a new model - TA Dynamic Model of Motivation which expands on Berne's concept of psychological hungers. The model can be used as a tool for personal motivation.

Author: Deepika Kaur
Article Title: Strokes and Impasse
TA and Other Concepts: Strokes, Stroke Economy, Stroke Filter, Types of Strokes, Impasses, Injunctions and Counterinjunctions
Key words: Strokes, Positive Conditional Strokes, Positive Unconditional Strokes, Stroke Filter, Stroke Economy, Impasse, Injunctions, Counter Injunctions
Summary of Article: The article explores the author's personal experience of accepting and rejecting strokes and uses the lens of Impasse theory to understand this phenomenon further.

Author: Gunjan Zutshi
Article Title: Group Relations and Psychotherapy: Learnings from Praxis
TA and Other Concepts: Projective Transference, Introjective Transference, Object Relations, Group Processes, Systemic Lens, Defenses, Splits, Identification
Key words: Group Relations, Groups, Transactional Analysis, Praxis, Psychotherapy, Systemic lens, Individual, Projective Transference, Introjective Transference, Object relations, Defenses, Splits
Summary of Article: This article explores the author’s experiences and dilemmas as a psychotherapist and Group Relations practitioner, of holding two different frameworks, the struggles of trying to integrate them, noting how the frameworks can be used as defense and therefore sometimes become limiting instead of enabling our work.

Author: Mitra Heidari
Article Title: Physis in Action
TA and Other Concepts: Physis, Metanoia, Ok-ness, Eros, Thanatos, Anti-Script, Self-Realization, Flow, Life Positions, Scale of Consciousness
Key words: Physis, Metanoia, Personality Growth, Self-Realization, Eudaimonia, Physis in Action, Eros, Thanatos, Flow, Scale of Consciousness, Quantum Physics, Biology, Morphic Resonance, Schumann Resonance, Heart math Coherence
Summary of Article: The Article introduces the concept of "Physis in Action" and its crucial role in personality growth and Self-Realization. The paper delves into the connection between the concepts of Metanoia and Physis, with an emphasis on the latter and provides a thorough exploration of Physis from multiple perspectives, including Transactional Analysis, while also presenting a new diagram that illustrates "Physis in Action"

Author: Rosemary Kurian, Sangeetha Dilipkumar and Susan George
Article Title: Impact of L.I.F.E. a Transactional Analysis Based Workshop, on the Mental Well-Being of College Students
TA and Other Concepts: Cycles of Development, Script, Cure, Inquiry, Attunement, Involvement, Functional Fluency, Time Structuring, Games, Working Styles, Racket Analysis, Problem Solving, Ethics, Action Planning, Self-Care, Modes of Behaving, Theory of Personalities, Attitudes
Key words: Mental Well-Being, Young Adulthood, L.I.F.E, Supervision, Education, Quasi-Experimental Design, Pre-test, Post-test, Warwick-Edinburgh Mental Well-being Scale, TA 101
Summary of Article: The article presents a research study which investitagates the effectiveness of a 40 hour Transactional Analysis based workshop (L.I.F.E)  on the mental well-being of its participants with the objective to encourage the incorporate TA based well-being programs as part of academic curriculum.

Author: Joy Roshan
Article Title: Power Positions and Power Moves: A Model to Understand Power Through the Lens of Transactional Analysis
TA and Other Concepts: Script, Power, Life positions, Qudrant of positions
Key words: Power, Power Positions, Power Moves, Quadrant of Power Positions, Real Power, Real Powerlessness, Scripty Power, Scripty Powerlessness, Empowerment, Disillusionment, Alignment, Acceptance, Moving on
Summary of Article: The author offers their perspective of power, borrowing from previous definitions and creating their own; they offer a quadrant model of power positions linking them to life positions. Using examples, the author offers strategies to reclaim power, increase awareness of internal limitations and align with reality.

Author: Keerthana Panneer
Article Title: Transactional Analysis of the Casteist Psyche
TA and Other Concepts: Systemic Injunctions, Ego States, Contaminations, Transactions, Games, Forced Contract, Cultural Parenting, Ulterior Transactions, Marshmallowing Strokes
Key words: Caste, Caste System, Casteist Continuum, Systemic Injunctions, Ego States, Contaminations, Transactions, Games, Forced Contract, Cultural Parenting, Intergenerational Trauma,
Summary of Article: The article offers an exposition of casteism in the Indian sub-context. Focusing on nuances of the mindset and pathology of perpetrators, sharing thought provoking and hard-hitting accounts, the author uses TA frameworks to highlight the casteist psyche. Sharing questions for reflection, the author invites the reader to reflect on their personal attitude and action/inaction towards the subject.

Author: Mitra Heidari
Article Title: Boosting Attachment Security and Promoting OKness
TA and Other Concepts: Attachment Theory, Attachment Styles, OK Corral, Life Positions, Attachment Security, Life Position Matrix Key, Proximity to the Self-ok Corral Model
Key words: Attachment Theory, Attachment Styles, OK Corral, Life Positions, Attachment Security, Existential Positions
Summary of Article: The articles draws parallels between attachment styles and life positions and the author shares their own model of Attachement Security.

Author: Aruna Gopakumar
Article Title: Relational Stroke CIty: Integrating 'Old' and 'New'
TA and Other Concepts: Strokes, Stroke City, Teach, Cooperative Contract, Structure, Drama Triangle, Rescue, Power Plays, Transactions, Intimacy, Stroke Economy, Groups
Key words: Strokes, Stroke City, Teach, Cooperative Contract, Structure, Drama Triangle, Rescue, Power Plays, No Lies, No Secrets, Transactions, Intimacy, Stroke Economy, Groups
Summary of Article: The article details the experiential group process of Stroke City; the author invites readers to value the wisdom and ideas from 'old' literature and authors and make it their own. The paper contains animated anecdotes of interactions and is a comprehensive guide for the Stroke City Methodology.

Author: Joy Roshan
Article Title: Working with Energy Hypothesis for Psychotherapeutic Change
TA and Other Concepts: Cathexis, Psychological Energy, Stuck, Bound Energy, Unbound Energy, Free Energy, Spontaneity, Physis, Trauma, Rubberbanding, Redecision,
Key words: Cathexis, Psychological Energy, Stuck, Bound Energy, Unbound Energy, Free Energy, Spontaneity, Physis, Trauma, Rubberbanding, Redecision
Summary of Article: The article explores the feeling of being stuck  through the concept of psychological energy; the author redefines some well known TA concepts through the lens of energy. Using some relatable cases, the author elaborates on how one may extricate oneslf usign free energy to change and grow.

Author: Nikita Bandale
Article Title: Closing Escape Hatches: Under the Cultural Lens
TA and Other Concepts: Scripts, Risk, Suicide, Self-harm, Escape Hatch, Escape Hatch Closure, Incongruity, Death, Socio-Political, Culture, Needed Relationship
Key words: Scripts, Risk, Suicide, Self-harm, Escape Hatch, Escape Hatch Closure, Incongruity, Death, Socio-Political, Culture, Needed Relationship
Summary of Article: The article delves into the process of escape hatch closure which is an imporant aspect of mitigating risk. The author invites readers to consider the role of culture in the process of escape hatch closure.

Author: Prathitha Gangadharan
Article Title: Covid and Trauma: Unravelling of Unconcious Processes & Script Protocol
TA and Other Concepts: Trauma, Unconscious Processes, Protocol, Therapeutic Relationship, Ego Image, Primal Image, Collective Trauma, Supervision, Countertransference, Window of Tolerance
Key words: Covid, Trauma, Unconscious Processes, Protocol, Therapeutic Relationship, Ego Image, Primal Image, Collective Trauma, Supervision, Countertransference, Window of Tolerance
Summary of Article: The author shares personal and client experiences of previously unexamined processes which emerged in therapy as a result of the trauma induced by the Covid pandemic. The paper attends to how difficult environments impel early childhood trauma to manifest insidiously. The author describes one client's conflicts where the safety and strength of the therapeutic relationship allowed for the addressal and healing of those wounds.

Author: Rosemary Kurian
Article Title: Empowering Our Present and Future with 'Humanness': A Mental Health Practitioner's Role in the Age of Artificial Intelligence
TA and Other Concepts: Social Roles Triangle, Ethics, Onion Model of Culture, Cultural Parent, Le Guernic, Positive Behaviours Triangle, Integrating Adult
Key words: Artificial Intelligence, Humanness, Biases, Social Roles Triangle,  Mental Health Practitioners, Simulate, Ethics, Ethical Considerations, Culture, Bias, Onion Model of Culture, Cultural Parent, Positive Behaviours Triangle, Integrating Adult
Summary of Article: The articles takes the reader into the realm of Artificial Intelligence, with a reminder that for AI to perform in a fair and unbiased manner, it is up to it's creators and its end users (especially calling out to mental health practitioners), to deeply examine our own prejudices and biases.

Author: Samiksha Jain
Article Title: Where There is a Will, There is a Way: Professional Will A Tool for Ethical Practice
TA and Other Concepts: Professional Will, Ethical Practice, Termination, Contract, Procedural Contract, Professional Contract, Psychological Contract, Ethics Grid,
Key words: Professional will, mental health, suicide, unforeseen circumstances, impairment, incapacitation, sudden termination, ethical practice, ethical growth, sudden demise, executor, re- traumatization, client protection, ethical closure, relational needs
Summary of Article: The article discusses the concept of a Professional Will - what it comprises, its importance and how it is drawn up. The author shares instances of the impact of doing so on the self, others and colleagues.

Author: Aruna Gopakumar
Article Title: Seeing You, Seeing Me, Seeing Us: Effectiveness of Role Reversals in One-to-One Supervision
TA and Other Concepts: Role Reversal, Supervision, Psychodrama, Countertransference, Unconscious Communication, Script, Parallel Process, Being, Potency
Key words: Role Reversal, Supervision, Psychodrama, Transactional Analysis, Countertransference, Unconscious Communication, Script, Parallel Process, Potency, Being, Enlivened
Summary of Article: The article delves into the use of technique of Role Reversal from Psychodrama in supervision to facilitate empathic therapeutic relating. The author invites readers to blend diverse modalities with TA to create fresh, meaningful experiences for clients, therapists, supervisors.

Author: Krishnan Madhabushi
Article Title: Using the Free Child in Bystander Intervention
TA and Other Concepts: Drama Triangle; Discounting Matrix; Contamination, Free Child, Intimacy, Spontaneity, Fourth Role, Bystanding
Key words: Bystander, Bystanding, Free Child, Drama Triangle, Discounting Matrix, Contaminations, Fourth Role, Responsibility, Creative, Oppression, Spontaneity, Intimacy, Compassion,
Summary of Article: The article addresses the phenomenon of bystanding, offering an explanation for why one bystands using previously postulated and alternate TA frameworks. The author shares a unique perspective on how to creatively use our Free Child to intervene.

Author: Aparna Vaidik
Article Title: Fairy Tales, Orphans and Happy Endings: A Psycho-historical Analysis
TA and Other Concepts: Script, Fairy Tales, Psychoanalysis, Social Context, Historical Analysis, Injunctive Messages, Drivers, Drama Triangle, Script Echoes, Psychic Resonance, Enactment, Happy Ending
Key words: Script, Fairy Tales, Children's Stories, Psychoanalysis, History, Cultural Dialogue, Social Context, Orphan, Injunctive messages, Enactment, Drama Triangle, Justice, Drivers, Script Echo, Psychic Resonance
Summary of Article: The author explores the ways in which TA theory can illuminate dimensions of fairy tales and children's stories that historical analysis misses out on and in doing so examines the commensurability between psychoanalysis and History.

Author: Suchitra Bhaskar
Article Title: Women at the Crossroads of Leadership
TA and Other Concepts: Working Styles, Role Ladder Model, Role Expectations, Gender, Communication
Key words: Leadership, Women, Coaching, Communication, Conflict Avoidance, Working Styles, Transitions, Support, Roles, Role Ladder Model, Role Expectations, Self-Awareness, Drivers, Gender
Summary of Article: The article presents TA frameworks that can be applied by consultants and HR professionals who work with and support women leaders during transitions. It explores application of organisational role concepts in communication and conflict avoidance and working styles to enable leaders to become more self-aware.

Author: Monzia Mushtaq and Tasnuva Huque
Article Title: The Vicious Cycle of Social Exclusion and Social Withdrawal in Intersex People
TA and Other Concepts: Injunctions, Drivers, Social Exclusion, Phenomenological Methodology, A Priori Coding
Key words: Social Exclusion, Intersex, Social Withdrawal, Injunctions, Drivers, A Priori Coding, Phenomenological Methology, LGBTQ, Ethical Considerations, Recommendations
Summary of Article: The article presents research conducted by the authors to explore whether any specific Drivers and Injunctions contribute to the social exclusion of Intersex people; the research employs phenomenological methology and a priori coding.

Author: Mahesh Natarajan
Article Title: Little Tribes, Large Rainbow People
TA and Other Concepts: Systems, Queer-Affirmative Therapy, Non-Affirmative Therapy, Trauma, Gender Binary, Sexuality, Queer Rights
Key words: Transactional Analysis, Systems, Queer Rights, Diversity, Gender, Sexuality, Affirmative Lens, Non-Affirmative, Conversion Therapies, Trauma, Non-Affirmative Therapy, Politcal, Legal, Gender Binary, Familial-Social Systems, Queer Affirmative
Summary of Article: The article presents the current status of queer affirmative / non-affirmative legal, social and therapy systems in India, expounding on the injustice of such norms and invokes practitioners to question their own methods and attittudes.

Author: Gunjan Z & Deepak D
Article Title: Contracting: A Way to Build Alignment and Collaboration in Cross Functional Teams
TA and Other Concepts: Contracts, Contracting, Cross Functional Team, Administrative Contracts, Professional Contracts, Psychological Contracts, Three Cornered Contract, Multi-Party Contracts, Psychological Distance
Key words: Contracts, Contracting, Cross Functional Team, Administrative Contracts, Professional Contracts, Psychological Contracts, Three Cornered Contract, Multi-Party Contracts, Psychological Distance
Summary of Article: The Article discusses the application of the concept of contracts in organisations, especially with cross functional teams (CFT) and how contracts can be used to build alignment and collaboration for team effectiveness.

Author: Charusmitha Rao
Article Title: A Wholesome View Into Scripts: Positive Memories Discovery Tool
TA and Other Concepts: Scripts, Positive Memories, Discovery Tool, Healing, Autonomy Matrix, Positive Psychology
Key words: Scripts, Positive Memories, Discovery Tool, Healing, Autonomy Matrix, Positive Psychology
Summary of Article: The article offers a set of questions as a tool that therapists and counsellors could use with their clients to discover, explore and strengthen positive memories of Script.

Author: Sarmishta Mani
Article Title: Impasse Clarification: A Relational Approach
TA and Other Concepts: Impasse, Impasse Clarification, Relational, Decisions, Unconscious, Intrapsychic Process, Transference, Transformational Transference, Relational Impasse, Intrpsychic Resolution, Repeated Relationship, Needed Relationship,
Key words: Impasse, Impasse Clarification, Relational, Decisions, Unconscious, Intrapsychic Process, Transference, Transformational Transference, Relational Impasse, Intrpsychic Resolution, Repeated Relationship, Needed Relationship,
Summary of Article: The article expands on Impasse in the therapist/client relationship as a source for exploring and transforming the interpersonal and intrapsychic processes of the client.

Author: Kala Balasubramanian
Article Title: De-Escalating Conflicts in Couples Using Interlocking Racket Systems
TA and Other Concepts: Interlocking Racket Systems, Racket System, Script, Script Beliefs, Early Decisions, Racket feelings, Breaking the Cycle
Key words: Interlocking Racket Systems, Couples, Conflict, Conflict Escalation, Childhood Experiences, Early Decisions, Racket System, Script, Breaking Cycle, Contract, Script Beliefs, Racket Feelings
Summary of Article: The article presents the application of Interlocking Racket System with couples. The author uses a case example to demonstrate techniques and interventions focused on de-escalating spiralling conflicts between couples.

Author: Yashodhara Lal
Article Title: A New Spin on the Permission Wheel
TA and Other Concepts: Permission Wheel, Permissions, Quadrants, Superpermissions
Key words: Permissions, Permission Wheel, Quadrants, Myself, Others, World, Feelings, Playpen, Superpermissions
Summary of Article: The article explores and 'plays' with Jaoui's Permission Wheel tool. Through mulling over how one internalizes permissions and their own process in writing this article, the author examines its potency and possibilities for its customization and usage.

Author: P K Saru
Article Title: Truth is One, Paths are Many
TA and Other Concepts: Autonomy, Physis, Bhagavad Gita, Freedom, Awareness, Action, Responsibility,  Spontaneity, Intimacy
Key words: Bhagavad Gita, Transactional Analysis, Freedom, Awareness, Action, Responsibility,  Spontaneity, Intimacy, Physis, Mukthi, Atma Gnana
Summary of Article: The article explores the attainment of life goals through the concepts of Autonomy & Physis, as compared with teachings from the Bhagavad Gita. The author delves into understanding what freedom, awareness, action and responsibility really mean and how these paths converge to one truth - being truly human.

Author: Rosemary Kurian
Article Title: Beyond Liminality - Resilience and Harmony
TA and Other Concepts: Liminality, Imaginal Cells, Motivators/Drives, OK Kraal
Key words: Liminality, Imaginal Cells, Motivators, Drives, OK Kraal, Covid Pandemic, Physis, Resilience, Harmony,
Summary of Article: The article explores the experience of the current pandemic through the lens of TA (Liminality, Physis, Imaginal Cells, Drives/Motivators, Ok Kraal) and examines how this new experience of uncertainty, fear, anxiety, stress, and change impacts us.

Author: John Heath
Article Title: Beyond Autonomy- From Self Development to Global Conversation
TA and Other Concepts: Autonomy, Self-Determination, Contextual Maturity, Wisdom, Functional Autonomy, Hierarchy of Human Needs, Biological Theory of Motivation, Paradox of Consciousness, Role of Psychotherapy,
Key words: Autonomy, Self-Determination, Contextual Maturity, Wisdom, Functional Autonomy, Hierarchy of Human Needs, Biological Theory of Motivation, Paradox of Consciousness, Role of Psychotherapy,
Summary of Article: The article explores personal experience (untaught motivation) as an innate wisdom of one's truth, goodness and beauty. Author establishes connections between self-acceptance, development and human consciousness with scientific beliefs to question wisdom beyong functional autonomy.

Author: Samiksha Jain
Article Title: Being Compatible, Co-operative and Intimate using TA
TA and Other Concepts: Couples, Intimate Partnerships, Co-operation, Compatibility, Adaptability, Harmony, Intimacy, Ego States, Behavioral Diagnosis, Transactions, Contracting
Key words: Couples, Intimate Partnerships, Co-operation, Compatibility, Adaptability, Harmony, Intimacy, Ego States, Behavioral Diagnosis, Transactions, Contracting
Summary of Article: The article expands on the use of TA theories & interventions to increase compatibility and intimacy in couples in intimate partnerships. The author uses excerpts from their own practice to describe how they look for cues in gestures, voice and words and employ those impressions to intervene appropriately.

Author: Zinnatul Borak
Article Title: Reclaiming Physis – A Case Study
TA and Other Concepts: Physis, Adverse Experience, Contract, Games, Drama Triangle, Racket Feelings, Contaminations, Johari Window, Ethics Grid, Egogram
Key words: Physis, Adverse Experience, Contract, Games, Drama Triangle, Racket Feelings, Contaminations, Johari Window, Ethics Grid, Egogram
Summary of Article: The article looks at using TA concepts and interventions in Individual therapy to further Physis. The author shares a case example, describing use of TA and other teachniques and models to demonstrate movement towards healing, change and physis.

SAJTA Theme: TA Training in India – Impact on Personal and Professional Self
Author: Chitra Ravi
Article Title: Transactional Analysis Training in India – My Personal Experience and Perspectives, Exploring, Expanding, Being Inclusive
TA and Other Concepts: TA Philosophy, Contracting, Core Aspects, Ethics Framework, Curriculum
Key words: TA Training, Inclusive, Philosophy, Contracting, Open Communication, Core Aspects, Ethics Framework, Objectives, Curriculum, Structure, Mutuality, Choice
Summary of Article: The article traces the author's journey in TA Training - describing the use of potent questioning and personal philosophy. The author expands on their methodology explained through their own model of training.

SAJTA Theme: TA Training in India – Impact on Personal and Professional Self
Author: Karen Pratt, Chitra Ravi
Article Title: The Value of Contracting in TA Training Groups
TA and Other Concepts: Contracting, Frames of Reference, Modelling, 5Ps,  Virtual Education Groups, Outcome Vs Process Contracting, Boundaries in face-to-face Psychotherapy Groups, Transference, Counter-Transference in Training, Appreciative Inquiry Exercise, Multiparty Contract, Process Reviews
Key words: Contracting, Frames of Reference, Modelling, 5Ps,  Virtual Education Groups, Outcome Vs Process Contracting, Boundaries in face-to-face Psychotherapy Groups, Transference, Counter-Transference in Training, Appreciative Inquiry Exercise, Multiparty Contracts, Cross-Cultural, Process Reviews
Summary of Article: In this article, Karen focuses on the importance of contracting in a multi-culture, virtual group setting with Educational groups; Chitra focuses on ownership and responsibility and the value of psychological and process contracting in Psychotherapy groups. The authors discuss the significance of working with transference and counter-transference in such groups and the value of contracting in creating authentic relationships and learning.

SAJTA Theme: TA Training in India – Impact on Personal and Professional Self
Author: Vidya Ramaswamy
Article Title: My Spiral of Growth – the TA way!.
TA and Other Concepts: Cycles of Development, TA Philosophy, OK Corral, Life Positions, Injunctions, Impasse,
Key words: Cycles of Development, Grief, Permissions, Loss, Choice, TA Philosophy, OK Corral, Life Positions, Injunctions, Impasse,
Summary of Article: The article follows movements and processes of understanding and updating fixed and  unhelpful patterns set in author's childhood. The author does this through an understanding of the non-linearity of life via the Spiral of Growth.

SAJTA Theme: TA Training in India – Impact on Personal and Professional Self
Author: Merlin Mythili S
Article Title: Exploring Autonomy through Time Structuring
TA and Other Concepts: Hungers, Time Structuring, Drivers, Games, Rackets
Key words: Hungers, Time Structuring, Drivers, Games, Rackets, Autonomy, Awareness
Summary of Article: The article is a personal narrative of how the author structured their time personally and socially through the concept of basic hungers. The author describes their movement from psychological games to autonomy.

SAJTA Theme: Impact of Culture- on an Individual, Community, Organization
Author: Anando Chatterji
Article Title: Cultures influencing Group Therapy
TA and Other Concepts: Group Psychotherapy,  Theoretical Frame of Reference, Culture, Social Constructs, Group Analysis, Therapeutic Communities, Belonging, Safety, Openness, Involvement, Agency, Ethical Dilemma, Oppression, Therapist Participation,
Key words: Group Psychotherapy,  Theoretical Frame of Reference, Culture, Social Constructs, Group Analysis, Therapeutic Communities, Belonging, Safety, Openness, Involvement, Agency, Ethical Dilemma, Oppression, Therapist Participation,
Summary of Article: This article looks to understand the culture prevalent within group therapy in India, explains framework of commonly used methodologies and newer advancements in conducting group therapy and highlights three dilemmas with explanations. Explores the influence of an individual’s culture in a group and it's interplay with the therapist’s own culture, creating a unique ‘group culture’.

SAJTA Theme: Impact of Culture- on an Individual, Community, Organization
Author: Gunjan Zutshi
Article Title: Organization Culture and Scripts
TA and Other Concepts: Organization Script, Organization Culture, Organization Dynamics, Culture of Group, Cultural Parent, Personality of Culture
Key words: Organization Script, Organization Culture, Organization Dynamics, Culture of Group, Cultural Parent, Personality of Culture, Etiquette, Technicalities, Character, Organization Script Questionnaire
Summary of Article: The article is a study of organisation scripts (as influenced by organisation culture) and their impact on organisation dynamics. An understanding of how culture is permeated within organisations is presented through a Case Study.

SAJTA Theme: Impact of Culture- on an Individual, Community, Organization
Author: Steff Oates
Article Title: Where is my culture now?
TA and Other Concepts: Culture, Script Development, Cultural Parent, Etiquette, Technicality, Character, Idiom, Rubberbanding
Key words: Culture, Script Development, Cultural Parent, Etiquette, Technicality, Character, Idiom, Rubberbanding, Reisman's Phases, Development of Human Society
Summary of Article: The article is a reflection of the author's own internal process - connected with the cultural differences that they hold. The author presents an understanding of themself through their script decisions, the cultural norms of their community and the influence each has on the other, in who they are today.

SAJTA Theme: Impact of Culture- on an Individual, Community, Organization
Author: Khushali Adhiya-Shah
Article Title: The Culture I Grew up in & the one I now Choose
TA and Other Concepts: Culture, Individualism, Collectivism, Horizontal Societies, Vertical Societies, Group Membership, Rigid Boundaries, Flexible Boundaries, Life Positions
Key words: Culture, Customs, Traditions, Values, Beliefs, Rules, Norms, Morals, Individualism, Collectivism, Horizontal Societies, Vertical Societies, Group Membership, Rigid Boundaries, Flexible Boundaries, Life Positions
Summary of Article: The article elaborates two generic paths for understanding culture: individualism and collectivism & horizontal and vertical societies, explaining traits of individuals and groups which propagate those cultures. The author uses Transactional Analysis to explain limiting influence of a vertical-collectivistic Indian culture on their own self-concept.

SAJTA Theme: Impact of Culture- on an Individual, Community, Organization
Author: Meenakshi Kirtane
Article Title: Centeredness – A forgotten Indian culture

Key words: Centeredness, Culture, History, Socio-Cultural Values, Script Formation, Loveless, Mindless, Joyless, Injunctions, Attributions, Counterscript, Script Decisions, Somatic Components, Antithesis, Connect
Summary of Article: This article is an exploration of Indian history and plausible links to formation of Loveless, Joyless, Mindless scripts. Categorizing their analysis, the author creates a socio-cultural Script Diagnosis, finally  suggesting an antitheses for each type of script.

SAJTA Theme: Impact of Culture- on an Individual, Community, Organization
Author: Krishnan Madhabushi
Article Title: Re-examining my cultural influences through TA
TA and Other Concepts: Culture, Cultural Influences, Script, Racket System, Commands, Attributions, Modelling, Injunctions, Stoicism
Key words: Culture, Cultural Influences, Script, Racket System, Commands, Attributions, Modelling, Injunctions, Stoicism
Summary of Article: The article is a personal account of the author's understanding of their own Life-Script and Racket System accounting for the influences from the culture they grew up in.

Author: Annie Cariapa
Article Title: I Here..You There: Separate & Connected
TA and Other Concepts: Life Positions, Episcripts, Boundaries, Attachment, Relational Approach, Secure Attachment, Insecure Avoidant Attachement, Insecure Ambivalent Attachment, Disorganised Attachement, Family Constellations, Entanglement

Summary of Article: THe article presents attachment patterns of children and impact on boundaries adult relationships through 2 case studies. The author presents an interesting take on how Episcripts can create unhealthy boundaries in a parent-child relationship and how their use of 'family constellations' modality proved effective in their work with the client.

Author: Tony White
Article Title: Projective Identification - A Rebuttal
TA and Other Concepts: Projective Identification, Games, Boundaries, Formula G, Kick me, NIGYSOB, Occam's Razor
Key words: Projective Identification, Games, Boundaries, Formula G, Kick me, NIGYSOB, Occam's Razor
Summary of Article: The article is based on Projective Identification is a new take on how game pairing occurs introducing instead the concept of Occam’s razor to explain hoow individuals enter into psychological games.

Author: Sailaja Manacha
Article Title: Respect and Value in Relationships
TA and Other Concepts: Boundaries, Healthy Relationships, Ego States, Drama Triangle, Life Script
Key words: Boundaries, Healthy Relationships, Ego States, Drama Triangle, Life Script
Summary of Article: The article explores the origins of how we develop healthy or unhealthy boundaries connected to Script and Drama triangle. The author offers reflective exercises and guidelines to build healthy boundaries.

Author: Srinath Nadathur
Article Title: Boundaries in Agile Coaching Contracts
TA and Other Concepts: Contracting, Agile, Role Boundaries, Open Communication, Transparency, Inspection, Adaptation, Self-Contract, Three Cornered Contract

Summary of Article: The article presents the use of contracting in agile coaching to facilitate open communication and transparency, which helps clarify  boundaries and responsibilities among various roles and relationships.

Author: Suriyaprakash C
Article Title: Ethical Dilemma
TA and Other Concepts: Ethics, Ethical Code, Bess Mode, Physis, Dharma, Ethical Dilemma, Synergy, Values
Key words: Ethics, Ethical Code, Bess Mode, Physis, Dharma, Ethical Dilemma, Synergy, Values
Summary of Article: The article forms the third part of a three part series on ethics; this article focuses on ethical practice in the organizational context when dealing with dilemmas, using the Bess model. The author brings a fitting finale to this series by comparing 'Dharma' to Berne's Physis.

SAJTA Theme:
Working through Conflicts –
internal and external
Author: Smita Chimmanda Potty
Article Title: In Conflict with Success
TA and Other Concepts: Script, Success, Conflicting Messages, Impasse Theory, Degrees of Impasse, Racket System, Contaminatins, Autonomy System, Psychodrama
Key words: Script, Success, Conflicting Messages, Impasse Theory, Degrees of Impasse, Racket System, Contaminatins, Autonomy System, Psychodrama
Summary of Article: The article is a personal account of the author's  experience of working through conflicting messages around success. The author uses the concepts of impasse theory, contaminations and the racket system to identify these conflicting messages and shares how they arrived at the autonomy system.
